title: Rosa Parks Refuses to Move
summary: On December 1, 1955, Rosa Parks, a Black seamstress in Montgomery, Alabama, refused to give up her seat on a city bus to a white passenger, defying segregation laws. Her arrest sparked the Montgomery Bus Boycott, a 381-day protest that became a landmark event in the American Civil Rights Movement and catapulted a young Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. to national prominence.
